sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都有"平的，平坦的"之意。
means: even ： 通常指平面上的各点或一条直线的各点处在同一平面或直线上。
flat ： 指光滑平整的表面，但不一定是水平的。
level ： 强调没有高低之处，且在同一水平面，可引申指才能相等或与相邻某物平行。
smooth ： 侧重指表面十分平滑，无任何粗糙的感觉。引申作圆滑解。

word_mean: 协调神经冲动的脑脊髓中枢：脑脊髓中枢协调神经冲动的水平分三级：第一级为脊髓，第二级为脑干，第三级为脑皮层
精神界域：在心理学上，表现自我意识和成人活动倾向的精神界域
水准仪，测量地面两点间高差的仪器。一般由望远镜、管状水准器或补偿器、竖轴、基座等组成。
水准仪，根据水准测量原理测量地面两点间高差的仪器。
电平， 一个时间变量，如功率或场量，在特定的时间间隔内以特定方式计算的均值或加权值。其单位可以用相对于基准值的对数形式表示，例如“分贝”。

其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting an instrument to determine whether a surface is horizontal): from Old French livel, based on Latin libella, diminutive of libra 'scales, balance'

entry.def: A level is a point on a scale, for example a scale of amount, quality, or difficulty.

example.ex: If you don't know your cholesterol level, it's a good idea to have it checked...
example.tran: 你要是不清楚自己的胆固醇水平，最好去检查一下。

example.ex: Michael's roommate had been pleasant on a superficial level...
example.tran: 迈克尔的室友表面上还算友善。

entry.def: The level of a river, lake, or ocean or the level of liquid in a container is the height of its surface.

example.ex: The water level of the Mississippi River is already 6.5 feet below normal...
example.tran: 密西西比河的水位已经比正常值低了6.5英尺。

example.ex: The gauge relies upon a sensor in the tank to relay the fuel level.
example.tran: 油表靠油箱里的感应器来显示燃料的液位。

entry.def: In cookery, a level spoonful of a substance such as flour or sugar is an amount that fills the spoon exactly, without going above the top edge.

example.ex: Stir in 1 level teaspoon of yeast.
example.tran: 加入一平茶匙的酵母后搅拌。

entry.def: If something is at a particular level, it is at that height.

example.ex: Liz sank down until the water came up to her chin and the bubbles were at eye level.
example.tran: 莉兹往下沉，直到水没过下巴，泡沫浮至眼睛。

entry.def: If one thing is level with another thing, it is at the same height as it.

example.ex: He leaned over the counter so his face was almost level with the boy's...
example.tran: 他倾身伏在柜台上，一张脸几乎凑到小男孩的面前。

example.ex: Amy knelt down so that their eyes were level.
example.tran: 埃米屈膝在地，两人目光相对平视。

entry.def: When something is level, it is completely flat with no part higher than any other.

example.ex: The floor was level, but the ceiling sloped toward his head.
example.tran: 地板是平的，但天花板朝他的头这边倾斜。

example.ex: ...a plateau of fairly level ground.
example.tran: 地势相当平坦的高原

entry.def: If you draw level with someone or something, you get closer to them until you are by their side.

example.ex: Just before we drew level with the gates, he slipped out of the jeep and disappeared into the crowd...
example.tran: 我们快到门前时，他溜出吉普车，消失在人群中。

example.ex: When the car had pulled level with him, he had spoken into the lowered passenger window.
example.tran: 汽车开到他身边与他并行时，他朝拉下车窗的后排座位说了几句话。

entry.def: If you draw level with someone, you manage to improve your performance until it is the same as theirs, by scoring the same number of points or goals as them.

example.ex: Napoli have drawn level with AC Milan at the top of the Italian league.
example.tran: 那不勒斯队追平了AC米兰队，并列意大利联赛排行榜的榜首。

entry.def: In sport, if a player or team levels the score, they score a goal or win some points so that their team has the same number of points or goals as the opposing team.

example.ex: Iglesias scored twice to level the score...
example.tran: 伊格莱西亚斯连进两球，追平了比分。

example.ex: The Cincinnati Reds have levelled the score in the National League play-off against the Pittsburgh Pirates.
example.tran: 在国家联盟季后赛中，辛辛那提红人队扳平了与匹兹堡海盗队的比分。

entry.tran: （语气）平稳的，平静的，不动声色的
entry.def: If you keep your voice level, you speak in a deliberately calm and unemotional way.

example.ex: He forced his voice to remain level...
example.tran: 他竭力使自己的语气保持平静。

example.ex: When Julie speaks of her disability, she talks in the same calm, level tones she uses to discuss her A level prospects.
example.tran: 谈到自己的残疾时，朱莉的语气一如谈及她的高级证书考试前景般冷静平和。

entry.def: If someone or something such as a violent storm levels a building or area of land, they destroy it completely or make it completely flat.

example.ex: Further tremors could level more buildings...
example.tran: 余震可能会摧毁更多的建筑物。

example.ex: The storm was the most powerful to hit Hawaii this century. It leveled sugar plantations and destroyed homes.
example.tran: 这是本世纪夏威夷遭遇的最强风暴。无数甘蔗园和住宅被夷为平地。

entry.tran: 使（指责、批评等）针对；使矛头指向
entry.def: If an accusation or criticism is levelled at someone, they are accused of doing wrong or they are criticized for something they have done.

example.ex: Allegations of corruption were levelled at him and his family...
example.tran: 他和他的家人受到了贪污指控。

example.ex: He leveled bitter criticism against the US.
example.tran: 他对美国提出了尖锐的批评。

entry.def: If you level an object at someone or something, you lift it and point it in their direction.

example.ex: He said thousands of Koreans still levelled guns at one another along the demilitarised zone between them.
example.tran: 他说在非军事区两边仍然有数以千计的韩国和朝鲜军人用枪互相瞄准对方。

entry.def: If you level with someone, you tell them the truth and do not keep anything secret.

example.ex: I'll level with you. I'm no great detective. I've no training or anything...
example.tran: 实话告诉你吧，我根本不是什么大侦探。我没有受过任何训练。

example.ex: He has leveled with the American people about his role in the affair.
example.tran: 他向美国人民坦白了他在这个事件中所扮演的角色。

entry.def: If you say that you will do your level best to do something, you are emphasizing that you will try as hard as you can to do it, even if the situation makes it very difficult.

example.ex: The President told American troops that he would do his level best to bring them home soon.
example.tran: 总统跟美军士兵说他会尽其所能让他们早日回家。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is on the level, you mean that they are sincere or honest, and are not attempting to deceive people.

example.ex: There were probably moments when you wondered if anyone spoke the truth or was on the level.
example.tran: 很可能有些时候你会怀疑，到底有没有人在说真话，有没有人是真诚的。

means.word_mean: 1. a position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality;

sentences.sentence: "a high level of care is required"
"it is all a matter of degree"

means.word_mean: 2. a relative position or degree of value in a graded group;
3. a specific identifiable position in a continuum or series or especially in a process;

sentences.sentence: "at what stage are the social sciences?"

means.word_mean: 4. height above ground;

sentences.sentence: "the pictures were at the same level"

means.word_mean: 5. indicator that establishes the horizontal when a bubble is centered in a tube of liquid
6. a flat surface at right angles to a plumb line;
7. structure consisting of a room or set of rooms comprising a single level of a multilevel building;
8. an abstract place usually conceived as having depth;

sentences.sentence: "a good actor communicates on several levels"
"a simile has at least two layers of meaning"
"the mind functions on many strata simultaneously"

means.word_mean: 1. aim at;
2. tear down so as to make flat with the ground;
3. make level or straight;
4. direct into a position for use;
5. talk frankly with; lay it on the line;
6. become level or even;
1. having a horizontal surface in which no part is higher or lower than another;
2. not showing abrupt variations;

sentences.sentence: "she gave him a level look"- Louis Auchincloss

means.word_mean: 3. being on a precise horizontal plane;
4. oriented at right angles to the plumb;
5. of the score in a contest;

means.word_mean: 水平, 等级

sentences.en: First we have to lift the level of instruction.
sentences.cn: 首先我们得提高教学水平。

means.word_mean: 同高度的; 同一程度的

sentences.en: He kept a level head through the whole incident.
sentences.cn: 整个事件中, 他始终保持着镇静的头脑。

sentences.en: In spring the river's surface is often level with the banks.
sentences.cn: 春天河水常常涨到与河岸一样高。

means.word_mean: 使成平面; 变成平面

sentences.en: A tornado leveled the entire business district.
sentences.cn: 龙卷风使整个商业区成为平地。

jushi.english: Prices have held the same level for a month.
jushi.chinese: 价格一直维持同等水平达一月之久。

jushi.english: The river often rises above the normal level.
jushi.chinese: 河水经常高出正常水位。

jushi.english: These decisions were made well below the level of top management.
jushi.chinese: 这些决定是由级别远远低于最高管理层的人员作出的。
